sentence.Network_en: I was not at all embarrassed : " For my trousseau. "
sentence.Network_cn: 我大言不惭地说: “ 我要备嫁妆哩. ”

sentence.Network_en: Has Mama forgiven you yet for picking out my trousseau?
sentence.Network_cn: 妈妈原谅你给我挑选礼服这件事情了 么 ?

sentence.Network_en: First time l heard of a father selecting a trousseau.
sentence.Network_cn: 我第一次听说一个父亲来挑选女儿的嫁妆.

in ancient Rome , whether having trousseau or not is an important symbol which discriminates official marriage and illegal marriage , thus the trousseau system became one important part of the Roman marriage property system .摘要在古罗马，有无嫁资是区分正式婚姻与拼合的重要标志，嫁资制

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French, diminutive of trousse 'bundle' (a sense also found in Middle English)

entry.def: A trousseau is a collection of clothes and other possessions that a bride brings with her when she gets married.

means.word_mean: 1. the personal outfit of a bride; clothes and accessories and linens
